title: fix: error when trying to join/leave a project or post a checkin or put a comment
message:
fix: error when trying to join/leave a project or post a checkin or put a comment

- we get a 403 from the Checkin API when the access token is invalid (for example expired)
- we now rewrite this to a 401 so our  Authenticator can try and refresh the token

title: fix: crash when sorting projects in ProjectAdapter
message:
fix: crash when sorting projects in ProjectAdapter

This change makes the Comparator<Project> handle invalid projects.

We sometimes got "Object is no longer valid to operate on. Was it deleted by another thread?"
This happens because we have two RealmResults<Project> and RealmResult<UserState> that are
updated at the same time. We delete some dangling projects, and we set a new UserState. The onChange(..)
listeners for both Project and UserState sort the Project list are called, but the order is arbitrary. So, we may call
sort from setUserState(..) where mProjectList now refers to invalid objects, and setUserProjects(..) haven't been
called yet.

Moral of the story: If you refer to other RealmResults in the onChange(..) of a RealmResult, you must check their validity as they may have been changed
and are not yet updated since their onChange(..) is called after yours.

More on Realm and threading here https://realm.io/news/threading-deep-dive/

We stop location updates when the app goes in the background or when transitioning between
fragments. This causes the UI to re-sort or update content a lot, since the first update has no location
and the following do. To fix this, I store the current location in CurrentLocation in Realm as a single
object. I then attach change listeners to that instead of direct location listener.

- to calculate the visited places in a project for the current user we count the number of place IDs from the project that we find in the Set<String>
